'Air Mobility Command' ('AMC') is a Major Command (MAJCOM) of the U.S. Air
Force. AMC is headquartered at Scott AFB, Illinois, east of St. Louis. [http://www.amc.af.mil/library/factsheets/factsheet.asp?id=229 Air
Mobility Command Fact Sheet]

The Commander of AMC is [http://www.af.mil/information/bios/bio.asp?bioID=7732
Gen. Paul J. Selva], with [http://www.af.mil/information/bios/bio.asp?bioID=7912
Lt. Gen. Robert R. Allardice] as Vice Commander, and
[http://www.amc.af.mil/library/amccommandchiefmastersgt.andykaiser.asp Chief
Master Sergeant Richard A. "Andy" Kaiser] as Command Chief Master Sergeant.

Air Mobility Command was established on June 1, 1992. It was formed from
elements of the inactivated Military Airlift Command (MAC) and Strategic Air
Command (SAC). AMC melded a worldwide airlift system (MAC) with a tanker force
(SAC) that had been freed from its commitments by the collapse of the Soviet
Union.
categories: Military units and formations established in 1992
